jopt.csp.spi.solver
Interface ChoicePointEntry

All Known Implementing Classes:
ChoicePointDataMap, ChoicePointNumArraySet
public interface ChoicePointEntry

Interface for objects that are referenced by a choice point stack and store information about problem state at a previous point in the search tree. Examples are the ChoicePointDataMap and ChoicePointNumArraySet. Note that the information about problem state is not store in the ChoicePointStack as the "stack" name might imply. Information is stored in ChoicePointEntry objects (which are mini-stacks themselves); these objects are referenced by the ChoicePointStack and are told to push and pop when the ChoicePointStack gets pushed and popped itself.

Method Summary
 java.lang.Integer getEntryID()
          Returns unique ID of map assigned to choice point stack
 void pop()
           Restores values in the current entry from data recorded in the internal stack.
 java.lang.Object popDelta()
          Restores values in the current entry from data recorded in the internal stack.
 void push()
           Handles pushing values in the current entry onto an internal stack that can be restored when the pop method is called
 void pushDelta(java.lang.Object delta)
          Handles pushing values in the current entry onto an internal stack that can be restored when the pop method is called
 void setListener(ChoicePointEntryListener listener)
          Sets listener for this entry
 

Method Detail

push

public void push()

Handles pushing values in the current entry onto an internal stack that can be restored when the pop method is called

This method is more efficient to the pushDelta method and is encouraged for use if delta information is not necessary

pushDelta

public void pushDelta(java.lang.Object delta)
Handles pushing values in the current entry onto an internal stack that can be restored when the pop method is called

pop

public void pop()

Restores values in the current entry from data recorded in the internal stack. Any listeners attached to this entry are notified that the values in the entry are about to be rolled back before the action takes place allowing listeners to act accordingly.

This method is more efficient to the popDelta method and is encouraged for use if delta information is not necessary

popDelta

public java.lang.Object popDelta()
Restores values in the current entry from data recorded in the internal stack. Any listeners attached to this entry are notified that the values in the entry are about to be rolled back before the action takes place allowing listeners to act accordingly.

Returns:
object containing changes that were rolled back

getEntryID

public java.lang.Integer getEntryID()
Returns unique ID of map assigned to choice point stack

setListener

public void setListener(ChoicePointEntryListener listener)
Sets listener for this entry
